intro: Veronica acrotheca, commonly known as the mountain veronica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and arranged in spikes. Veronica acrotheca is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
